moves.1. e4: A game won from almost a zero situation. I thought I could get opinions on what else could have transpired.
moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 e6 3. Nc3 d6 4. d4 cxd4 5: Move targetting . e5 dxe5 fxe5 but of course that is wishful thinking.
moves.8... h6 9. Bh4 Be7 10. f5 Nxe4 11. Bxe7: Black gains a pawn in the exchange.
moves.14. O-O: White's rook has an open flange which is often a good position.
moves.14... O-O 15. Qf3: An attack on black's b pawn.
moves.15... d5 16. Rae1: If an opening occurs then white will capture black's f rook.
moves.16... Nd7 17. Qg3 Qc5: Black is actually attacking the c3 pawn but it is quite a poisoned piece.
moves.18. Kh1: No attempt to move the white bishop.
moves.18... Rae8 19. Nf3: It would seem that the poisoned pawn is now safe to capture. But I was looking there when making this move and hoping black thought so too.
moves.20. Ng5: As is clear, it was a mistake.
moves.20... Qc6 21. Nh7: Bishop exchange would have made less sense.
moves.21... Nc5 22. Nxf8 Nxd3: A sure mistake by white in not capturing the knight straight away.
